Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial on Pharyngeal and Laryngeal Alterations in ABI Patients with Nasogastric and Tracheostomy Tubes

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable due to the retrospective nature of the study.

Participants.evidence: 103 ABI patients with NGT indwelled for more than 1 month, admitted to Huashan Hospital, Fudan University, from October 2019 to October 2023.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were divided into two groups based on tracheostomy status.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to explore the effects of prolonged nasogastric tube (NGT) and tracheostomy on pharyngeal and laryngeal structures in patients with acquired brain injury (ABI).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the presence of structural abnormalities, measured at the time of FEES.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable due to the retrospective nature of the study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The NGT–TRACH group exhibited higher rates of epiglottis shape abnormality, glossoptosis, and pharyngeal stenosis compared to the NGT group (p < 0.05).

Harms.evidence: The study did not report adverse events.

Funding.evidence: Funding: The study did not specify funding sources.
